'''Particles''' are very simple objects (much simpler than [[actor]]s) that are used by [[ZDoom]] for several special effects: * Missile trails behind actors with the {{Flag|GRENADETRAIL}} or {{Flag|ROCKETTRAIL}} flags. * Helix trail around [[railgun]] attacks. * Red, green, blue, yellow, purple, black or white {{Class|ParticleFountain|particle fountains}} actors. Since they are extremely simple, the engine can supports displaying thousands of particles at once. Authors can also spawn their own particles, using [[ZScript]], [[DECORATE]] or [[ACS]], as described below. == Functions == There are several ways to spawn particles and define their appearance: * [[A_SpawnParticle]] is a function available in ZScript and DECORATE that allows spawning particles with custom color, size, position, velocity and other parameters. * [[A_SpawnParticleEx]] is a ZScript-only function. In contrast to {{c|A_SpawnParticle}}, this extended function allows attaching a graphic to particles, thus giving them custom appearance, which can potentially be very effective for creating effects like debris, smoke and others. It also allows giving the particles rotation and animation. * [[SpawnParticle (ZScript)]] is a ZScript-only struct-using version of {{c|A_SpawnParticle}}. * [[SpawnParticle]] is an ACS function with capabilities similar to {{c|A_SpawnParticle}}. == Console variables == The following [[console variables]] affect particles: * [[Display options#Rocket trails|cl_rockettrails]] * [[Display options#Blood type|cl_bloodtype]] * [[Display options#Bullet puff type|cl_pufftype]] * [[Display options#Number of particles|r_maxparticles]] * [[CVARs:Display#r_rail_smartspiral|r_rail_smartspiral]] * [[CVARs:Display#r_rail_spiralsparsity|r_rail_spiralsparsity]] * [[CVARs:Display#r_rail_trailsparsity|r_rail_trailsparsity]] * [[OpenGL preferences#Particle style|gl_particles_style]] {{OpenGLsmall}} == Colors == The default non-textured particles can have one of the following colors:
